item.title: Robert Downey Jr.'s Son Pleads Guilty in Drug Case
item.description: The son of actor Robert Downey Jr. pleaded guilty on Friday to cocaine possession and was sentenced to a drug diversion program that could result in his conviction being dismissed.

item.title: In Disaster-Hit Kashmir, a Collective Story of Human Determination
item.description: They have been walking for days carrying whatever little of their belongings they could save, often without food or water, as they make their way to somewhere safe from the flood-hit terrains of Kashm...

item.title: By-polls in Three Lok Sabha, 33 Assembly Seats: Will Modi Wave Continue?
item.description: Gujarat's Vadodara constituency vacated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi is among the 36 Lok Sabha and assembly seats across nine states where by-elections will be held today.

item.title: Why Yuvraj Singh Met BJP President Amit Shah
item.description: On the very day the Election Commission announced dates for the assembly elections in Haryana, the BJP seems to have found a star campaigner to bat for the party in the Congress-ruled state.

item.title: NRI Investments in Indian Realty May Rise 35 Per Cent in 2014: Survey
item.description: Property developers are expecting a 35 per cent surge in real estate enquiries from NRIs (non-resident Indians) with Bangalore turning out to be a favourite, according to a survey by industry body Ass...

item.title: Oscar Pistorius Verdict 'Not Right', Say Reeva Steenkamp's Parents
item.description: The parents of Reeva Steenkamp, who was shot and killed by Oscar Pistorius, reacted with disbelief at a judge's decision to acquit the star athlete of murder charges.

item.title: Court Sets Aside Election Commission's Show-Cause Notice Against Ashok Chavan
item.description: The Delhi High Court has set aside the Election Commission's show-cause notice against former Maharashtra Chief Minister Ashok Chavan for allegedly fudging poll expenses during the 2009 assembly elect...

item.title: Now Kamal Nath Says Manmohan Singh May Have Made a Mistake

item.title: Virat Kohli Needs to Improve Poor Technique, Says Geoffrey Boycott
item.description: Team India continues to struggle abroad because their young stars have failed to adapt to different conditions and their problem was psychological, said former England captain Geoffrey Boycott.

item.title: Blog: In Srinagar, I Waited Four Nights for a Boat
item.description: "For four nights, I waited for a boat to be able to reach my parents"

item.title: Scotland 'Yes' Vote Would Trigger Dispute Over Old Oil Rigs
item.description: Scotland will ask Britain to help finance the cost of removing old North Sea rigs and pipelines even if it votes for independence and gains most of the oil revenues, a move that bankers and lawyers sa...

item.title: Card Payment Network RuPay Sees Boost From Government Banking Scheme
item.description: Started in 2012 by a company owned by 10 local and foreign banks, RuPay competes with global payment firms Visa Inc and MasterCard Inc for the few customers in Asia's third largest economy able to aff...

item.title: Mirza Has Change of Heart, Decides to Play Asian Games
item.description: In a huge boost to India's tennis prospects at the Asian Games, Sania Mirza has confirmed her participation in Incheon from September 19 to October 4.

item.title: Oscar Pistorius's Next Battle, Avoiding South Africa's Most Brutal Jail
item.description: After his conviction on Friday for the negligent killing of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp on Valentine's Day last year, Olympic track star Oscar Pistorius's next battle will be to stay outside the wa...

item.title: At Srinagar Children's Hospital, the Immense Tragedy of 11 Babies
item.description: Without power, ventilators stopped working. Army evacuated 600 people.

item.title: Malala Yousafzai's Attackers Arrested Two Years After She Was Shot by Taliban
item.description: The Pakistani army said on Friday it had arrested the gunmen who tried to kill schoolgirl campaigner Malala Yousafzai in the country's restive northwest in 2012.

item.title: Man Blackmails Ex-Girlfriend With Sex Tape, Asks Her to Clean House
item.description: A man in New Zealand tried to blackmail his former partner into cleaning his apartment by threatening to post a sex tape online, a court said.

item.title: Maharashtra and Haryana will vote on October 15, Results on October 19
item.description: Maharashtra and Haryana will vote for their next government on October 15; results will be declared on October 19.

item.title: On Camera, Villagers Beaten Mercilessly As 'Lesson' For Being Informers
item.description: A chilling video has emerged of villagers being beaten brutally in Meghalaya by suspected militants who allegedly wanted to make an example out of "informers".

item.description: Two college girls have been hospitalised in Madurai after a man threw acid on them in Madurai. The incident took place in Thirumangalam this afternoon when the girls were walking out of the college af...

item.title: Opinion: Well Done, Sushmaji
item.description: Her Afghanistan visit signals continuity, says Shashi Tharoor.

item.title: Oscar Pistorius, Guilty of Culpable Homicide, to be Sentenced on October 13
item.description: South African Judge Thokozile Masipa on Friday extended Oscar Pistorius's bail and set a date of October 13 for sentencing on a charge of culpable homicide.
